data.title: Audio device selector
data.body:
This cleans up and builds on the previous versions by @Fahrradkette and @Mailaender.
The sound engine and device preferences have been combined into a single dropdown.

data.title: Noncombatant map buildings should not be invisible underneath fog
data.body: This issue makes neutral oil derricks etc invisible until you send a unit there, when ShroudInfo.Shroud is false.

data.title: Highlight on username in chat
data.body:
I noticed that some players dont pay attention to the chat (ingame and lobby). It would be nice to play some kind of BEEP to the player if you write his name. Autocomplete nicknames with tab would be usefull, too. 
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/669961-highlight-on-username-in-chat?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Added an audio device swapper
data.body:
This is mostly a cleanup of #3594 with
- clearer GUI instructions
- cnc settings dropdown cosmetics
- moved GetDeviceList to ISoundEngine implementations

data.title: Wobbly turrets
data.body: When an actor with turret moves at certain angles (mosty "in-between"-angles like NNE and so on), the turret's position seems to 'lag' behind the body a little, resulting in a somewhat annoying wobbling of the turret. I'm not sure if this was the case before the refactoring.

data.title: First LocalOffset value ignored on Guard Tower and Avd. Guard Tower
data.body: It appears on buildings without a real turret the first value of LocalOffset (the 'forward' value) is ignored. It doesn't matter for the Advanced Guard Tower, but on the regular Guard Tower it looks strange and makes it impossible to set up a proper firing offset.

data.title: WithMuzzleFlash as Actor trait instead of Weapon/Armament trait is inconvenient
data.body:
In my opinion it would be not just more intuitive for modders, but also more flexible if the muzzle flash was defined as weapon- or armament trait. Right now, it's hardcoded to be an actor sub-sequence called 'muzzle' and automatically used for all armaments of that actor, regardless of weapon type. This is not just unintuitive, but also unflexible, for example a mammoth tank would display the muzzle flash for both its cannons AND missiles. For custom mods wanting to implement even more than two different weapons on a units things only get worse.

It would be nice if this was given an above-average priority, I'd gladly fix all LocalOffsets and set up muzzle flashes for tanks etc. for all mods shipped with OpenRA.

data.title: after surrender still can deploy parabombs
data.body: After losing a game one can still deploy parabombs as a spectator - this shouldn't be....

data.title: Split keyboard/mouse focus and use C&C world tooltips in RA/D2K.
data.body: Removes unnecessary duplication and fixes some longstanding bugs.

data.title: Fixes cnc mod mouse cursor
data.body: Looks like color #12 got replaced with color #0 during conversion from dune2 shp to cnc shp. I fixed mouse2.shp by converting the original shp again with a custom palette (no black as color #0) and then manually fixed mouse4.shp.

data.title: Support TS-style terrain lighting
data.body: This should be straightforward to do by changing the GL blend mode or using a custom fragment shader to lighten fragments under the spotlight circle.

data.title: Changes track title of Afterlife to Await
data.body: The file is called await_r.aud and the ingame title in RA was Await, too. As far as I can tell, the title 'Afterlife' first came up in the old RAMIXer's database, and was copy-pasted to XCC Mixer's database. But there is no indication that Afterlife really is/was supposed to be the real in-game title of this track.

data.title: Added a Tiberian Sun test mod
data.body: This adds a lot of YAML files for Tiberian Sun with sequences and rules for all units I found in RULES and ART.INI files. I noted the obvious problems with `#TODO`. Help is very welcome as you can see this far from ready to release.

data.title: Unit does not have sequence defined always errors about the first, not the real one that is missing
data.body:
`System.InvalidOperationException`: Unit `weedguy` does not have sequence `stand` defined.

``` yaml
weedguy:
    stand: weed
        Start: 0
        Facings: 8
        ShadowStart: 202
    run: weed
        Start: 8
        Length: 6
        Facings: 8
        Tick: 100
        ShadowStart: 210
    shoot: weed
        Start: 56
        Length: 1
        Facings: 8
    prone-shoot: weed
        Start: 212
        Length: 6
        Facings: 8
    standup-0: weed
        Start: 260
        Length: 2
        Facings: 8
    prone-run: weed
        Start: 86
        Length: 4
        Facings: 8
        Tick: 100
        ShadowStart: 288
    prone-stand: weed
        Start: 144
        Length: 4
        Facings: 8
        ShadowStart: 346
    die1: weed
        Start: 160
        Length: 6
        ShadowStart: 336
    die2: weed
        Start: 149
        Length: 14
        ShadowStart: 351
    die3: weed
        Start: 166
        Length: 10
        ShadowStart: 368
    die4: weed
        Start: 197
        Length: 5
        ShadowStart: 399
    die5:
        Start: 177
        Length: 19
        ShadowStart: 379
    die6: electro
        Start: 0
        Length: *
```

I just forgot about `die5`, but the wrong message thrown is just confusing here.

data.title: Sound extensions for Red Alert missions
data.body: I forgot to add the .aud extensions when adding WAV support for Dune 2000 which caused #3478 and #3598.

data.title: Fixed various music player problems
data.body: including #3360

data.title: LoadSound, file does not exist: tank6
data.body:
Discovered because @Fahrradkette moved it to sound.log in #3594:

```
LoadSound, file does not exist: tank6
Attempt to Play2D a null `ISoundSource`
```

data.title: Medics and Mechanics heal enemies
data.body: Whenever forced, medics or mechanics will heal enemy units. This can be a problem when forcing a group of units to attack.

data.title: Fog visibility freezing
data.body:
This hides a few effects that shouldn't be visible behind the fog:
- Explosions / gunfire
- Infantry death animations
- Smoke

The state of resource fields, smudges, and bibs (if enabled) are frozen as they were last seen.

The repair and powerdown icons are hidden for cloaked units (or any other IVisibilityModifier, including HiddenUnderFog if enabled).

I have dropped the FrozenUnderFog improvements for now, as this will need some low level changes for faking the order targeters against frozen buildings where the backing actor was destroyed.

data.title: More improvements to nod01
data.body: The mission is somewhat more playable now, reinforcements don't just randomly spawn they actually walk into the map, the gameplay was tweaked somewhat so it should be a more enjoyable mission. Only major issue is that the losing victory conditions don't work you can lose all your units and still not die, i'm probably just not seeing something really obvious :| sure someone else will be able to figure that out.

data.title: Audio device swapper
data.body: Allows the user to pick an other device then the default one from a list of devices available to the OpenRA framework. Game needs to be restarted in order to apply this change.

data.title: Fix for #3573
data.body: Fixes #3573 (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/3573) and some other minor changes.

data.title: Convert projectiles to world coordinates.
data.body:
This ports the projectile code to world coordinates, which was the last of the simulation code to go.

Notable non-refactoring changes:
- Artillery trails don't instantly vanish when the projectile hits.
- Carpet bombs can now accelerate when falling.
- Missiles now account for altitude (#3347), and have a configurable climb rate.
- Finer grained vector -> facing calculations (it was previously limited to 32 facings).

data.title: Add an Unload voice for when a unit is unloading.
music track info does not change
data.body: Open the music menu (i did this in cnc) let a song play to finish it will go on to play the next song but the menu will still show the previous track name and total length.

data.title: scripted notes for a player-kick/ban
data.body:
i would suggest some scripted notes (the admin/host can select from them by kick or ban a player) for the new kick/ban option. 

people may learn from it ...

data.title: Powerdown indicator is no longer shown on powered down buildings
